description.plain:
Purity Ring is an electronic duo formed in Edmonton, Canada, consisting of lyricist and singer Megan James and producer Corin Roddick.

Although a purity ring is a religious item that shows chastity, the duo doesn’t want their name to be understood that way.

The way you might first interpret it, not thinking about it beyond just being words, it’s how you are supposed to interpret it.

They released their first album, Shrines, to critical acclaim in 2012. Their second album another eternity followed in 2015, and their third full-length, WOMB, dropped in 2020.

Aside from their work as a group, they have also collaborated with a diverse group of other artists, including Jon Hopkins, Ab-Soul, Katy Perry, and Danny Brown.

Although a purity ring is a religious item that shows chastity, the duo doesn’t want their name to be understood that way.

The way you might first interpret it, not thinking about it beyond just being words, it’s how you are supposed to interpret it.

They released their first album, Shrines, to critical acclaim in 2012. Their second album another eternity followed in 2015, and their third full-length, WOMB, dropped in 2020.

Aside from their work as a group, they have also collaborated with a diverse group of other artists, including Jon Hopkins, Ab-Soul, Katy Perry, and Danny Brown.

songs.title: Fineshrine

description.plain:
A few lines into “Fineshrine,” the second track on Purity Ring’s debut album Shrines, the Canadians’ many qualities collide in staggering fashion.

It’s crisp and precise, but dense with feeling, filling a gulf between clinical sheen and lung-collapse heartbreak.

That’s just a love song. [Laughs] It really is.
- Megan James, the singer and writer

songs.embed_content: Read “Fineshrine” by Purity Ring on Genius

songs.lyrics:
22 ContributorsFineshrine Lyrics[Hook]
Get a little closer, let fold
Cut open my sternum, and pull
My little ribs around you
The lungs of me be under, under you

[Verse 1]
I'll cut the soft pockets, let bleed
Over the rocky cliffs that you leave
To peer over and not forget what feet are
Splitting threads of thunder over me
[Pre-Hook]
That I might see with my chest and sink
Into the edges round you
Into the lakes and quarries that brink
On all the edges round you, round you, round you

[Hook]
Get a little closer, let fold
Cut open my sternum, and pull
My little ribs around you
The lungs of me be crowns over you

The lungs of me be under, under you

[Verse 2]
I'll cut the soft pockets, let bleed
Over the rocky cliffs that you leave
To peer over and not forget what feet are
Splitting threads of thunder over me

Listen closely, closely to the floor
Emitting all its graces through the pores
You make a fine shrine in me
You build a fine shrine in me

That I might see with my chest and sink
Into the edges round you

songs.title: ​​bodyache

description.plain:
The third single from their 2015 sophomore album another eternity, “bodyache,” was released alongside a music video on February 26th, 2015.

This electro-dreampop track is among the rest of their glistening wonders from another eternity.

songs.embed_content: Read “​​bodyache” by Purity Ring on Genius

songs.title: ​​begin again

description.plain:
The second single for their 2015 album Another Eternity, following “Push Pull”. According to Purity Ring:

This might be the first full-on love song [we’ve written]. It’s kind of obvious, I think, and I’m not usually obvious. Also, we pulled the album title from the lyrics, so that’s another interesting thing to note.

songs.embed_content: Read “​​begin again” by Purity Ring on Genius

Begin again, begin again, begin again

A lonely company

Oh, guard the pounding sound
